Description: Wall fragment of Chian(?) pottery vase; slipped on exterior. Antithetically placed ivy leaves between dilute bands with added black dots; above (or below?), loops of probable frieze of interlinked buds. Orientation uncertain.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
In his review of Venit Boardman wonders whether this may not be Fikellura.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 54, no. 188 pl. 44)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.600)
